snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include the influence of Silicon Valley on Stanford, Google scientists talking about building a “Star Trek” computer...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include the influence of Silicon Valley on Stanford, Google scientists talking about building a “Star Trek” computer and how a decision decades ago to make cellphones without dial tones later helped texting technology.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: E-Mail Cachet and Cellphone Dial Tones
